info.title: Lead Market API
info.description:
The Lead Market API allows you to:
- Create and update leads to sell via Lead Market.
- Manage blacklists to avoid buying specific leads.
- Provide progress updates and outcomes for purchased leads.
- Retrieve the status or details of a lead.
- Request delivery of the Credit Sense report for a bought lead.
- Update the reference for a lead's Credit Sense application.

### About these API docs
These API docs are provided in OpenAPI Specification (OAS) format for your reference. Use the `Download` button atop this page to download these API docs as an OAS 3-compliant JSON document that you can import into the API client of your choice (e.g. [Postman](https://www.postman.com/), [Insomnia](https://insomnia.rest/), [Swagger Inspector](https://inspector.swagger.io/builder)).

You can also click one of the buttons below to import the API spec into an API client you have installed.

[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/da63c952ac2450a1701c)
[![Run in Insomnia}](https://insomnia.rest/images/run.svg)](https://insomnia.rest/run/?label=Lead%20Market%20API&uri=https%3A%2F%2Fapi-docs.creditsense.com.au%2Flead-market%2Fv1%2FLead-Market-API.v1.json)

Click the chevrons next to object names and response codes to expand out the request and response schemas.
![alt text](https://rmeredithcs.github.io/lead-market-v1-api/API_docs_guide.gif "API docs guide screen recording")

### Request URL
The request URL is built using multiple components - `{protocol}` `{base-url}` `{version}` `{api-key}` `{endpoint}`
1. All calls to the API must be made using the TLS **protocol** - `https://`
2. The **base URL** is always [api.leadmarketonline.com](api.leadmarketonline.com) - `https://api.leadmarketonline.com`
3. The current **version** is v1 - `https://api.leadmarketonline.com/v1`
4. The **API key** will be unique to your environment - `https://api.leadmarketonline.com/v1/xxx-xxx-xxx`
5. The **endpont** will be determined by what you're trying to do - `https://api.leadmarketonline.com/v1/xxx-xxx-xxx/exampleEndpoint`

### Authentication
Each call to the API requires:
- **API key** - identifies your account; forms part of the request URL.
- **API token** - identifies your access to the API; included in the `Settings` object in your request body.

If you don't have your API credentials or you'd like them to be changed, please [contact us](mailto:support@leadmarketonline.com).

### Rate Limiting *****IS THIS A THING ON LEAD MARKET?*****
The API is rate limited at one API call per second, with the ability to handle a burst of up to 20 API calls depending on the amount of API credits available.

#### How do API credits work?
- Every API call uses an API credit. 
- Your account receives one API credit every one second and can accrue a maximum of 20 credits at any time.
- When your API credits run out the API will return a '429 - Too Many Requests' status code, indicating that you will need to retry your API call after waiting for your API credit balance to increase.

api-key.description: The unique key that identifies your account.

Warnings.description: A list of warnings. e.g. features that are soon to be deprecated or features that are not yet supported by the API.

Success.description: Denotes whether the lead was successfully created.

Data.description: The Lead ID as an integer or an object containing the Lead ID and Lead Token.

Lead_ID.description: Uniquely identifies the lead across Lead Market.

Lead_Token.description: Uniquely identifies the lead across Lead Market for the Seller.

error_type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

error_code.description: The code that identifies the error.

post.description:
Retrieve reports in the requested formats for a specified application.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Create a disengaged lead and push it into the market for sale.
- Pass in lead details for an engaged lead that will be retrieved when the lead is pushed into the market.

### Non-compliant HTTP status codes
We have some non-compliant status codes that are returned in place of recognised HTTP status codes when specific errors occur.

#### 701: Schema Validation Error
Schema validation errors indicate that the data you've provided is invalid XML or it doesn't conform to our Seller schema.

##### Example errors
| Error message                                                                                                                        | Possible cause                                                                                                                           |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Fatal Error 4: Start tag expected, '<' not found                                                                                     | Missing '<' at beginning of document.                                                                                                    |
| Error 1872: The document has no document element.                                                                                    | Missing root element. This may also show in various other situations, including if you do not escape xml reserved characters (like "&"). |
| Error 1826: Element 'Application_Date': '2016-08-10b' is not a valid value of the union type 'L_Empty_Date'.                         | Date supplied is in incorrect format.                                                                                                    |
| Error 1843: Element 'Application': Character content other than whitespace is not allowed because the content type is 'element-only' | Some text is not properly contained in an element.                                                                                       |
| Fatal Error 76: Opening and ending tag mismatch: Lead line 1 and Seller_Data                                                         | A tag has not been correctly opened or closed.                                                                                           |

#### 702: Authentication Error
Authentication errors errors indicate that you're not authorised to perform the requested actions.

##### Example errors
| Error message                                                                       | Possible cause                                                                                                        |
|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Invalid API_Token                                                                   | The API_Token you passed in doesn't match the API_Key you used in the url.                                            |
| Invalid CS_App_ID for API_Token                                                     | CS_App_ID doesn't exist or doesn't belong to you.                                                                     |
| Invalid Lead_ID for API_Token                                                       | Lead_ID doesn't exist or doesn't belong to you.                                                                       |
| Invalid Buyer_Token for API_Token                                                   | The Buyer_Token provided does not correspond to any leads you have purchased.                                         |
| Invalid CS_App_ID for Client_ID                                                     | If you use the optional Client_ID parameter in settings. CS_App_ID doesn't exist or doesn't belong to this Client_ID. |
| Client_ID not valid for API_Token                                                   | The Client_ID supplied doesn't exist or doesn't belong to you.                                                        |
| Your API Key has not been activated yet, please contact us to activate your API key | The API profile your provided credentials link to is inactive. Contact us to activate it.                             |

#### 703: Data Error
Data errors indicate that there's a mismatch between multiple bits of data you've provided.

##### Example errors
| Error message                                                                                                                              | Possible cause                                                                                                                                                                             |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Lead_ID and CS_App_ID don't match                                                                                                          | If you have provided both Lead_ID and CS_App_ID, these two numbers don't match on our database.                                                                                            |
| The Credit Sense application was completed more then 24 hours ago. For a lead to be sold the application must be completed within 24 hours | The CS_App_ID you have provided references a Credit Sense application that was completed more than 24 hours ago. For a lead to be sold, the application must be completed within 24 hours. |
| The fields 'Lead_ID' and 'Buyer_Token' were both missing, please include one in your API call                                              | You have not provided either Lead_ID or Buyer_Token; one must be provided.                                                                                                                 |
| The fields 'Lead_ID' and 'Buyer_Token' were both present, please include only one in your API call                                         | You have provided both Lead_ID and Buyer_Token; only one may be provided.                                                                                                                  |
| Settings object key: 'App_Reference' has not been provided                                                                                 | The App_Reference parameter is missing from the API call.                                                                                                                                  |

#### 704: Other Error
Other errors indicate that there's a generic problem, not described above.

| Error message                                                                                                                                                                                  | Possible cause                                                                              |
|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| The API credentials you have provided are testing credentials and you haven't provided a valid Test_Sale_Outcome. When using test credentials you must include the Test_Sale_Outcome parameter | You're testing against a dev/test org unit and failed to pass in a valid test sale outcome. |

Settings.description: A JSON-encoded object containing all the settings for your request.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Test_Sale_Outcome.description: The test sale outcome code you specify will determine the sale outcome to be returned. This is used for testing purposes only.

Client_ID.description: When provided, overrides the default Lead Market org unit attached to the API profile and creates the lead against the specified org unit.

Payload.description: Contains the details of the lead in XML format in accordance with our Seller schema.

requestBody.description:
### Testing sale outcomes
Pass a test sale outcome from the below table into `$.Settings.Test_Sale_Outcome` to simulate having a lead sell or fail to sell.
Providing a test sale outcome is required if using API credentials linked to a test environment and an error will be returned if it is omitted.
Providing a test sale outcome is not permitted if using API credentials linked to a production environment and an error will be returned if it is included.
Any errors encountered processing your request will override your specified test sale outcome - i.e. you must provide valid data in order to test sale outcomes.

| Code | Name         | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|------|--------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1    | Make sale    | Results in the lead being sold and sold lead notifications will trigger. Use this outcome to how your system handles sold leads.                                                                                                                                             |
| 2    | No Buyer     | Results in the lead being returned due to no buyer and unsold lead notifications will trigger. Use this outcome to how your system handles unsold leads.                                                                                                                     |
| 3    | Already Sold | Results in the lead being returned due to the lead already existing on the market.

post.summary: Get the status of a lead

Warnings.description: A list of warnings. e.g. features that are soon to be deprecated or features that are not yet supported by the API.

Success.description: Denotes whether the lead status was successfully returned.

Data.description: An object containing status information about the lead.

Status_Type_Code.description: The code that identifies the status type.

Status_Code.description: The code that identifies the status.

enum: Recalled - Lead already on market by same seller
Error - no active bid on client

Sale_Data.description: An object containing sale data if the lead is sold or bought. If the lead isn't sold or bought, the value will be `null`.

Lead_Price.description: The sale price for the lead.

Lead_ID.description: Uniquely identifies the lead across Lead Market.

CS_App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the Credit Sense application.

Sale_Base_Amount.description: The base sale amount for the lead.

Sale_Base_Amount_Tax.description: The tax amount for the base sale amount of the lead. This will be `0` if no tax is due for the sale.

Sale_Trade_Comm_Amount.description: The trade commission amount for the lead.

Sale_Trade_Comm_Amount_Tax.description: The tax amount for the trade comission on the lead. This will be `0` if no tax is due for the sale.

Sale_Net_Amount.description:
**Sellers:** The base sale amount less the trade comission.
**Buyers:** The base sale amount plus the trade comission.
All amounts are tax-inclusive.

Sale_Currency.description: Denotes the [currency](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes) that lead sale amounts are expressed in.

error_type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

error_code.description: The code that identifies the error.

error_type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

error_code.description: The code that identifies the error.

error_message.default: No endpoint exists for this URL.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Lead_ID.description: Uniquely identifies the lead across Lead Market.

post.description:
Get the status of a specific lead.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Understand whether a lead has sold.
- Retrieve sale data for a sold lead.

### Lead status
The status of the lead is broken down as below.

| Status type code | Status type description | Status code | Status description                             |
|------------------|-------------------------|-------------|------------------------------------------------|
| 1                | Bought                  | 1           | Bought                                         |
|                  |                         | 2           | Bought - Cust Notified                         |
| 2                | On Market               | 10          | Resell Pending                                 |
|                  |                         | 12          | Pending CS App                                 |
|                  |                         | 13          | Analysing Data                                 |
|                  |                         | 14          | On Market                                      |
|                  |                         | 15          | Waiting Sale                                   |
| 3                | Sold                    | 20          | Sold                                           |
|                  |                         | 21          | Sold - Cust Notified                           |
| 4                | Recalled                | 3           | Recalled                                       |
|                  |                         | 4           | Recalled - Lead already on market              |
|                  |                         | 5           | Recalled - No Buyer                            |
|                  |                         | 22          | Recalled - Lead already on market bysameseller |
| 5                | Preparing to Sell       | 11          | Pending Client                                 |
|                  |                         | 16          | Error - no active bid on client                |

### Non-compliant HTTP status codes
We have some non-compliant status codes that are returned in place of recognised HTTP status codes when specific errors occur.

#### 701: Schema Validation Error
Schema validation errors indicate that the data you've provided is invalid XML or it doesn't conform to our Seller schema.

##### Example errors
| Error message                                                                                                                        | Possible cause                                                                                                                           |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Fatal Error 4: Start tag expected, '<' not found                                                                                     | Missing '<' at beginning of document.                                                                                                    |
| Error 1872: The document has no document element.                                                                                    | Missing root element. This may also show in various other situations, including if you do not escape xml reserved characters (like "&"). |
| Error 1826: Element 'Application_Date': '2016-08-10b' is not a valid value of the union type 'L_Empty_Date'.                         | Date supplied is in incorrect format.                                                                                                    |
| Error 1843: Element 'Application': Character content other than whitespace is not allowed because the content type is 'element-only' | Some text is not properly contained in an element.                                                                                       |
| Fatal Error 76: Opening and ending tag mismatch: Lead line 1 and Seller_Data                                                         | A tag has not been correctly opened or closed.                                                                                           |

#### 702: Authentication Error
Authentication errors errors indicate that you're not authorised to perform the requested actions.

##### Example errors
| Error message                                                                       | Possible cause                                                                                                        |
|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Invalid API_Token                                                                   | The API_Token you passed in doesn't match the API_Key you used in the url.                                            |
| Invalid CS_App_ID for API_Token                                                     | CS_App_ID doesn't exist or doesn't belong to you.                                                                     |
| Invalid Lead_ID for API_Token                                                       | Lead_ID doesn't exist or doesn't belong to you.                                                                       |
| Invalid Buyer_Token for API_Token                                                   | The Buyer_Token provided does not correspond to any leads you have purchased.                                         |
| Invalid CS_App_ID for Client_ID                                                     | If you use the optional Client_ID parameter in settings. CS_App_ID doesn't exist or doesn't belong to this Client_ID. |
| Client_ID not valid for API_Token                                                   | The Client_ID supplied doesn't exist or doesn't belong to you.                                                        |
| Your API Key has not been activated yet, please contact us to activate your API key | The API profile your provided credentials link to is inactive. Contact us to activate it.                             |

#### 703: Data Error
Data errors indicate that there's a mismatch between multiple bits of data you've provided.

##### Example errors
| Error message                                                                                                                              | Possible cause                                                                                                                                                                             |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Lead_ID and CS_App_ID don't match                                                                                                          | If you have provided both Lead_ID and CS_App_ID, these two numbers don't match on our database.                                                                                            |
| The Credit Sense application was completed more then 24 hours ago. For a lead to be sold the application must be completed within 24 hours | The CS_App_ID you have provided references a Credit Sense application that was completed more than 24 hours ago. For a lead to be sold, the application must be completed within 24 hours. |
| The fields 'Lead_ID' and 'Buyer_Token' were both missing, please include one in your API call                                              | You have not provided either Lead_ID or Buyer_Token; one must be provided.                                                                                                                 |
| The fields 'Lead_ID' and 'Buyer_Token' were both present, please include only one in your API call                                         | You have provided both Lead_ID and Buyer_Token; only one may be provided.                                                                                                                  |
| Settings object key: 'App_Reference' has not been provided                                                                                 | The App_Reference parameter is missing from the API call.                                                                                                                                  |

#### 704: Other Error
Other errors indicate that there's a generic problem, not described above.

| Error message                                                                                                                                                                                  | Possible cause                                                                              |
|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| The API credentials you have provided are testing credentials and you haven't provided a valid Test_Sale_Outcome. When using test credentials you must include the Test_Sale_Outcome parameter | You're testing against a dev/test org unit and failed to pass in a valid test sale outcome. |

Success.description: Denotes whether the lead was successfully created.

Data.description: The Lead ID as an integer or an object containing the Lead ID and Lead Token.

error_type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

error_code.description: The code that identifies the error.

post.description:
Get the details for a specific lead.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Retrieve all details for a sold or bought lead.

### Non-compliant HTTP status codes
We have some non-compliant status codes that are returned in place of recognised HTTP status codes when specific errors occur.

#### 701: Schema Validation Error
Schema validation errors indicate that the data you've provided is invalid XML or it doesn't conform to our Seller schema.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Lead_ID.description: Uniquely identifies the lead across Lead Market. If this is omitted, `$.Buyer_Token` must be present.

Buyer_Token.description: Uniquely identifies the lead across Lead Market for the Buyer. If this is omitted, `$.Lead_ID` must be present.

Extra_Info_Only.description: Specify whether you'd like to only receive lead details added via the Lead Market buyer form.

post.description:
Provide application outcomes for leads you've bought.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Feed funding outcomes into Smart Campaigns so further train and refine your Smart Campaigns algorithm.
- Provide application outcomes in order to track conversion rates and cost per contract metrics via the Lead Market dashboard.

get.description:
Returns a collection of blacklist lists.
 
Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Retrieve all blacklist

Returns the details of the specified blacklist.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Retrieve an individual blacklist

Returns the individual items in the specified blacklist.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- To check the values that are blacklisted
- To check if particular values are blacklisted by your organisation

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: The minimum create date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: The maximum create date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

Lead-schema.title: Lead schema
Lead-schema.description:
The structure of lead details for both sellers and buyers. 

Shared objects between Sellers and Buyers:
- `$.Lead.Applicant`
- `$.Lead.Application`

Seller-only object:
- `$.Lead.Seller_Data`

Buyer-only objects:
- `$.Lead.Buyer_Data`
- `$.Lead.Decision_Points`

### Seller data validation
We take what may be thought of as a lax approach to validation on most data passed in by Sellers. This is not done to make Buyers integrations difficult; when a Seller is passing in details via the API itâ€™s generally due to the lead not being engaged at the time. The stance we take on this is _itâ€™s better to have some data that **may** be invalid, than no data_. A good example is when a customer provides a valid mobile number, but in the email address field of a Leadgenâ€™s website. Weâ€™ll provide the raw values as the Seller has pushed them into Lead Market, and weâ€™ll also provided validated contact details in the `$..V_Contact_Type` and `$..V_Contact_Value` fields.

Applicant_Type.description: The type of applicant (e.g. Primary, Guarantor, Secondary, Business, etc.)

References.description: Information about the relationship between the customer and any referees.

Relationship_Type.description: The referee's relationship to the applicant (e.g. friend, mother, employer, etc.)

Known_Applicant_Years.description: The number of years the referee has known the customer.

Title.description: The person's title (e.g. Mr, Mrs, Ms, Dr, etc.)

Contact_Other.description: Contact details (e.g. phone numbers, email addresses etc.)

Contact_Type.description: The type of contact method (e.g. mobile, email, skype, work, home, fax, etc.)

Contact_Value.description: The contact (e.g. email address, mobile number, skype address, etc.) For phone numbers we recommend using international format (e.g. AU = +614..., CA = +1..., NZ = +642...).

State.description: AU = State or Territory, CA = Province or Territory, NZ = Town or City.

Is_Current.description: Denotes whether this is the person's current address.

Residential_Type.description: The type of residence (e.g. house, unit, rural, acreage, etc.)

Residential_Status.description: The person's relationhsip to the address (e.g. renting, buying, boarding, etc.)

Time_At_Address_Months.description: The number of months the person has lived/did live at the address.

Financials.description: Information about the customer's income and liabilities.

Detailed_Income.description: Detailed information about the customer's current or previous income.

Source.description: The name of the source of the customer's income (e.g. Coles, Municipality of Manitoba, Vodafone, etc.)

Type.description: The customer's income type (e.g. salary, benefits, rental, gift, etc.)

Frequency.description: The frequency with which the customer is paid (e.g. weekly, fortnightly, monthly, etc.)

Description.example: This is the customer's primary income

Net_Amount.description: The net amount of the customer's pay per frequency.

Gross_Amount.description: The gross amount of the customer's pay per frequency.

Is_Current.description: Denotes whether the source of income is current.

Detailed_Liability.description: Detailed information about the customer's current liabilities.

Type.description: The type of liability (e.g. ongoing, once-off).

Frequency.description: The frequency with which the liability is paid (e.g. weekly, fortnightly, monthly, etc.)

Frequency_Amount.description: The amount paid towards the liability per frequency.

Balance.description: The amount currently owing on the liability.

Start_Date.description: The date that the customer assumed the liability.

Estimated_End_Date.description: The estimated date that the customer will finalise the liability.

Description.description: Description of the liability (e.g. rent, loan, living expenses, education, etc.)

Summary_Income.description: Summary information about the customer's current income.

Net_Amount.description: The net amount of the customer's pay per frequency.

Gross_Amount.description: The gross amount of the customer's pay per frequency.

Frequency.description: The frequency with which the customer is paid (e.g. weekly, fortnightly, monthly, etc.)

Summary_Liability.description: Summary information about the customer's current liabilities.

Amount.description: The amount paid towards the liability per frequency.

Frequency.description: The frequency with which the liability is paid (e.g. weekly, fortnightly, monthly, etc.)

Bank_Accounts.description: Information about the customer's bank accounts.

Bank_Name.description: The name of the customer's bank.

Account_Type.description: The type of account (e.g. savings, cheque, etc.)

BSB.description: The customer's BSB or routing (transit) number.

Age_Of_Account.description: The age of the customer's account in years.

tags.name: Applications
tags.description: Create and update leads, retrieve the status or details of a lead, or update the reference for a lead's Credit Sense application.

tags.name: Bought lead outcomes
tags.description: Provide progress updates and outcomes for purchased leads.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Automatically receive reports as soon as they're generated.

Please refer to our [webhook help docs](https://docs.creditsense.com.au/display/CSI/Fully+integrated+webhook#space-menu-link-content).

tags.name: Schemas
tags.description: References describing the data formats we accept and deliver.
